articles.headline: Why I Can’t Bet Against Apple’s Mixed-Reality Prowess
articles.snippet: There are plenty of reasons the Vision Pro could flop. But we shouldn’t forget that Apple has a knack for entering a product category at just the right time.
articles.abstract: There are plenty of reasons the Vision Pro could flop. But we shouldn’t forget that Apple has a knack for entering a product category at just the right time.
articles.lead_paragraph: I’ll confess that when Apple introduced its mixed-reality Vision Pro headsets on Monday, one of my first thoughts was: Man, that thing looks weird.

articles.headline: Wildfire Smoke Blots Sun and Prompts Health Alerts in Much of U.S.
articles.snippet: The smoke was pouring across the border from Canada, where hundreds of wildfires remain unchecked, and the hazardous smoke conditions are expected to linger through Wednesday and perhaps until later in the week.
articles.abstract: The smoke was pouring across the border from Canada, where hundreds of wildfires remain unchecked, and the hazardous smoke conditions are expected to linger through Wednesday and perhaps until later in the week.
articles.lead_paragraph: An eye-watering and cough-inducing smoky haze from Canadian wildfires smothered a swath of the eastern and northern United States on Tuesday, with officials warning residents with health risks to stay indoors and keep their windows closed.
articles.byline: By Jesus Jiménez, Derrick Bryson Taylor and Judson Jones

articles.headline: Prince Harry, in Dramatic Testimony, Says Journalists Have ‘Blood on Their Hands’
articles.snippet: In a remarkable court scene, the prince took the stand for five hours to make his case that his phone was hacked by a newspaper group, as a lawyer for the defense grilled him about his claims.
articles.abstract: In a remarkable court scene, the prince took the stand for five hours to make his case that his phone was hacked by a newspaper group, as a lawyer for the defense grilled him about his claims.
articles.lead_paragraph: Follow our updates as Prince Harry resumes his testimony.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Megan Specia

articles.headline: Destroyed Ukrainian Dam Floods War Zone and Forces Residents to Flee
articles.snippet: Experts suspect an explosion collapsed the dam on the Dnipro River. Kyiv and Moscow blamed each other, and residents downstream were forced to evacuate to escape the cascading waves.
articles.abstract: Experts suspect an explosion collapsed the dam on the Dnipro River. Kyiv and Moscow blamed each other, and residents downstream were forced to evacuate to escape the cascading waves.
articles.lead_paragraph: A major dam on the Dnipro River in southern Ukraine was destroyed early Tuesday, sending torrents of water cascading through the breach, flooding a war zone downstream, putting tens of thousands of residents at risk and raising the possibility of long-lasting environmental and humanitarian disasters.
articles.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer, Marc Santora, Haley Willis and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

articles.headline: Crypto Firms Start Looking Abroad as U.S. Cracks Down
articles.snippet: As the country becomes one of the world’s strictest crypto regulators, companies are exploring plans to expand internationally and possibly leave entirely.
articles.abstract: As the country becomes one of the world’s strictest crypto regulators, companies are exploring plans to expand internationally and possibly leave entirely.
articles.lead_paragraph: The wave of government enforcement against cryptocurrency companies is beginning to remake the industry.

articles.headline: Wildfires Spread Smoke, and Anxiety, Across Canada to the U.S.
articles.snippet: Massive plumes of smoke from hundreds of Canadian fires, enveloped millions in smoke, triggering dangerous air quality warnings in both countries and turning skies an ashen orange.
articles.abstract: Massive plumes of smoke from hundreds of Canadian fires, enveloped millions in smoke, triggering dangerous air quality warnings in both countries and turning skies an ashen orange.
articles.lead_paragraph: Canada on Wednesday was struggling to fight an extraordinary outbreak of wildfires across the country that sent smoke pouring over the border and forced millions of Canadians and Americans to stay indoors as skies darkened over large portions of both nations.
articles.byline: By Dan Bilefsky, Liam Stack and Vjosa Isai

articles.headline: Russia and Saudi Arabia’s Oil Partnership Shows Strain
articles.snippet: Analysts said the countries’ mutual need to keep energy prices high would help them maintain close ties, despite signs that Moscow has undercut previous deals.
articles.abstract: Analysts said the countries’ mutual need to keep energy prices high would help them maintain close ties, despite signs that Moscow has undercut previous deals.
articles.lead_paragraph: For most of the last six years, the leaders of Russia and Saudi Arabia worked with each other to control the global oil market during times of war, pandemic and dizzying price gyrations.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and Anatoly Kurmanaev

articles.headline: They Fled San Francisco. The A.I. Boom Pulled Them Back.
articles.snippet: Tech entrepreneurs who left the Bay Area during the pandemic say they can’t afford to miss out on the funding, hackathons and networking of the artificial intelligence frenzy.
articles.abstract: Tech entrepreneurs who left the Bay Area during the pandemic say they can’t afford to miss out on the funding, hackathons and networking of the artificial intelligence frenzy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Doug Fulop’s and Jessie Fischer’s lives in Bend, Ore., were idyllic. The couple moved there last year, working remotely in a 2,400-square-foot house surrounded by trees, with easy access to skiing, mountain biking and breweries. It was an upgrade from their former apartments in San Francisco, where a stranger once entered Mr. Fulop’s home after his lock didn’t properly latch.

articles.headline: How Sam Altman Stormed Washington to Set the A.I. Agenda
articles.snippet: The chief executive of OpenAI, which makes ChatGPT, has met with at least 100 U.S. lawmakers in recent months. He has also taken his show abroad.
articles.abstract: The chief executive of OpenAI, which makes ChatGPT, has met with at least 100 U.S. lawmakers in recent months. He has also taken his show abroad.
articles.lead_paragraph: Weeks after OpenAI released its ChatGPT chatbot last year, Sam Altman, the chief executive of the artificial intelligence start-up, launched a lobbying blitz in Washington.

articles.headline: Chris Licht Is Out at CNN, Leaving Network at a Crossroads
articles.snippet: Mr. Licht’s turbulent time running the 24-hour news organization lasted slightly more than a year.
articles.abstract: Mr. Licht’s turbulent time running the 24-hour news organization lasted slightly more than a year.
articles.lead_paragraph: At 7 a.m. on Wednesday, as a cloud of smoke enveloped Manhattan, Chris Licht left his apartment building and strolled half a block to Central Park for a meeting with his boss, David Zaslav.
articles.byline: By John Koblin, Benjamin Mullin, Michael M. Grynbaum and James B. Stewart
